item.title: R-Loops at Centromeric Chromatin Contribute to Defects in Kinetochore Integrity and Chromosomal Instability
item.description: Prashant K. Mishra, Arijita Chakraborty, Elaine Yeh, Wenyi Feng, Kerry S. Bloom and Munira A. Basrai R-loops, the by-product of DNA-RNA hybridization and the displaced single stranded DNA, have been identified across the domains of life. The persistent presence of R-loops contributes to defects in DNA replication and repair, gene expression, and genomic integrity. R-loops have not been detected at centromeric (CEN) chromatin in wild-type budding yeast and its physiological significance in chromosome segregation remains unexplored.
